info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 04 at 11:03AM CDT until April 11 at 2:12PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LA SALLE...SOUTHERN OGLE AND LEE COUNTIES... At 1102 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Deer Grove to Walnut to near Wyanet to near Buda, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Dixon, Peru, La Salle, Rochelle, Mendota, Oregon, Amboy, Oglesby, Davis Junction, North Utica, Hillcrest, Franklin Grove, Ashton, Paw Paw, Tonica, Lost Nation, Sublette, Woodhaven Lakes, Creston and Lindenwood. This includes... Castle Rock State Park, Illinois Valley Community College, Lee County Fairgrounds, Matthiessen State Park, Sauk Valley College, Starved Rock State Park, and Tri-County Fairgrounds. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 49 and 113. I-80 between mile markers 74 and 84. I-88 between mile markers 45 and 82. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
